goal.core.program

Class SelectExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.program.SelectExpression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SelectExpression
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A SelectExpression represents a single agent or a variable agent or a dynamic set of agents (i.e. ALL agents, SOMEOTHER agent). Run-time resolution of the AgentExpression depends on its type, and in the case of SELF, ALL and SOME also on the running agent itself.
    Author:
    W.Pasman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SelectExpression.SelectorType
      Selector types represent different categories of selector expressions that can be used as prefixes of mental atoms and actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectExpression

        public SelectExpression(SelectExpression.SelectorType type,
                Term term)
        Creates a SelectExpression for one of the reserved selector types SelectExpression.SelectorType.CONSTANT and SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE.
        Parameters:
        type - A selector type SelectExpression.SelectorType.CONSTANT or SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE.
        term - A Term representing either the constant or variable selector.

      • SelectExpression

        public SelectExpression(SelectExpression.SelectorType type)
        Creates a SelectExpression for one of the reserved selector types other than SelectExpression.SelectorType.CONSTANT and SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE.
        Parameters:
        type - A selector type other than SelectExpression.SelectorType.CONSTANT and SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - In case the value of type is a constant or variable type.

    • Method Detail

      • applySubst

        public SelectExpression applySubst(Substitution substitution)
        Applies the given Substitution to this SelectExpression in case the expression is of SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE. In that case, the substitution is applied to the variable. And then it's tested if the new value is one of the special SelectExpression.SelectorTypes. If it's not a SelectExpression.SelectorType.VARIABLE, the original expression is returned.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The substitution to be applied to the action.
        Returns:
        The instantiated expression where the substitution has been applied to the variable in case the expression's type is VARIABLE; otherwise the original expression is returned.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Checks whether this SelectExpression is closed, i.e., does not contain any occurrences of (free) variables.
        Returns:
        true if the expression is of another type

      • getType

        public SelectExpression.SelectorType getType()
        Returns:
        The type of this expression

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        A textual representation of this expression

      • getFreeVar

        public java.util.Set<Var> getFreeVar()
        Returns the free variables in the agent expression. This is only relevant for VARIABLE type agent expressions, so return an empty set if it is of an other type.
        Returns:
        The free variables
